job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.industry: Information Services,Information Technology and Services,Computer Networking
job.description: <p>We are working with the Senior manager of a life sciences company that is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) who will be responsible for supporting Linux and Kubernetes based deployments and Google Cloud Platform.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications:&nbsp;</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 3+ years of experience supporting infrastructure and services in public cloud environments (GCP).</li><li>Demonstrable experience with automation and orchestration to enable</li><li>Accelerated infrastructure, application and software configuration deployment</li><li>Automated response to alerts or indicators of performance issues</li><li>Infrastructure as code</li><li>Reliability – driving fault detection and correction, performance and uptime at a global scale</li><li>Observability – instrument systems to gain visibility and understanding of how systems are performing and detecting anomalous behavior</li><li>Deep understanding Linux/Unix system internals</li><li>Working knowledge of network protocols and network based services, including routing, network load balancing and web proxy appliances / applications</li><li>Experience building and supporting containerized application technologies including Docker, kubernetes</li><li>Familiarity with CI/CD tools and deployment processes, GitLab a strong preference</li><li>Proficient with various programming languages such as Python/Java/Go for building automation or integration with APIs</li><li>Passion for eliminating repetitive manual processes using automation, including a focus on writing detailed solution specifications, best practices/standards documentation, operating procedures, run books, etc.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Kafka, Active MQ, IBM MQ, Amazon RDS, Amazon Auroroa desirable.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills, should be capable of working with cross functional technical and business teams and varying levels of management</li></ul>
